entry.title: Newsletter #36
entry.content:
It’s TechThursday again: here’s what we’ve been excited about over the past week!

  • Web Fundamentals, A handbook for best practices (by Google)
  • Object schema description language and validator for JavaScript objects
  • Hardware development for software developers: Tessel is a microcontroller that runs JavaScript, node-compatible and with Wifi built in.
  • Cool slides about Protractor, E2E test framework for Angular apps
  • ECMAScript 6 in Node.JS
  • Javascript Promises… in wicked detail
  • boot2docker is a lightweight Linux distributionmade specifically to run Docker containers.
  • Faster AngularJS Rendering (AngularJS and ReactJS)
  • (old) The restart page
  • Hands on with Ubuntu 14.04: The best Ubuntu desktop ever
  • Solr 4.8.0 released
  • How Gilt uses Grunt
  • Add AJAX to your web application using simple, declarative HTML attributes
  • Generate docs from markdown files
  • 21 things that became obsolete this decade
  • Gulp as a Development Web Server
  • Skype leaves Sensitive User Data Unencrypted Locally On Computers
  • PHP: do it better!
